title: Retirement Myths Debunked: You Don't Need $5 Million to Retire
content:
Retirement Myths Debunked: You Don't Need $5 Million to Retire

If you think you need $5 million just to retire, you've been lied to. I'm Tyler, a former financial advisor and portfolio manager, and now I create financial content for free so that you don't have to pay for it.

Retirement is not about hitting an arbitrary number. It's about cash flow. Here's what I mean.

Most people think that they need a huge nest egg because they're planning to withdraw only 4% a year. This rule was created decades ago when bond yields were much higher and people were terrified of running out of money. While that fear hasn't really changed, here's the truth:

If I were to stay 100% invested in stocks, I can, according to the numbers, draw down up to 7% per year and still have over a 96% chance of never running out of money.

The point is this: You don't need millions to retire. You need the right strategy. If you want to see the math on how I've done this myself, sign up for my free newsletter, and I'll send you over some numbers this weekend.
subtitle: Discover the truth about retirement funding and why cash flow is more crucial than hitting a specific nest egg. Learn about effective strategies to achieve financial freedom.
